title: Alex Bregman shares his advice for younger Red Sox teammates down the stretch
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Alex Bregman advises Red Sox teammates to simplify approaches as they strive for an AL wildcard spot.
Red Sox hold a record of 81-68, sitting in the second wildcard position with 13 games remaining.
Bregman, batting .279, hit his first home run since August 12 in a recent loss to the Yankees.

title: 3 takeaways from the Revolution’s 1-1 draw vs. Toronto FC
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: New England Revolution tied Toronto FC 1-1 at Gillette Stadium with a late equalizer from Luca Langoni in the 90th minute.
The Revolution's playoff chances remain slim but alive due to Chicago's loss, keeping them in 11th place in the Eastern Conference.
18-year-old Allan Oyirwoth made his first MLS start, impressing with calm possession and strong cross-field passes.

title: ‘We should stop talking October’: Alex Cora doesn’t want Red Sox to start thinking about playoffs yet
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Red Sox manager Alex Cora advises against focusing on playoffs, emphasizing the need to improve current gameplay.
Boston holds the second AL wild-card spot, trailing the Yankees by 1.5 games and leading Rangers by 3 games.
Remaining schedule challenges include tougher opponents for Red Sox than Rangers, affecting playoff race dynamics.

title: Red Sox CBO Craig Breslow reportedly prioritizing finding a GM this offseason
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Red Sox CBO Craig Breslow seeks to hire a general manager as second-in-command this offseason.
The general manager role has been vacant since Breslow took over baseball operations in 2024.
Five assistant GMs, including Raquel Ferreira and Eddie Romero, are potential candidates for the position.

title: Patriots move on from Ja’Lynn Polk, reportedly trading him to Saints
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Patriots trade wide receiver Ja'Lynn Polk to the Saints for a 2027 sixth-round pick and a 2028 seventh-round pick.
Polk, a 2024 second-round pick, had 12 receptions, 87 yards, and two touchdowns amidst performance issues and controversies.
The Patriots now have six receivers under contract for 2026, with Polk out for the 2025 season due to a shoulder injury.

title: 5 things to know about Dolphins before Patriots take them on in Week 2
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Patriots face a five-game losing streak against the Dolphins in Miami ahead of their Week 2 matchup.
Dolphins' Tyreek Hill has lacked big plays recently but poses a threat, especially with Patriots' cornerback changes.
Tua Tagovailoa remains undefeated in seven starts against the Patriots, completing 69% of his passes in those games.

title: Review & setlist: Ethel Cain haunts Roadrunner with Southern Gothic epic
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: Ethel Cain performed a Southern Gothic-themed concert at Roadrunner in Boston on September 12, 2025.
The concert featured tracks from her album 'Willoughby Tucker, Iâ€™ll Always Love You' alongside shoegaze band 9Million.
Ethel Cain was joined by Jae Matthews for 'Vacillator' and ended with an encore including 'A House In Nebraska'.

title: 45 years later, Andover High’s Chiklis returns to gridiron for ‘The Senior’
author: Lauren Daley
bullets: Michael Chiklis stars in 'The Senior,' portraying Mike Flynt, a man who returned to college football at 59.
The film, directed by Rod Lurie, has an exclusive Boston screening on September 14 before the national release.
Chiklis, an Andover High alum, had not played tackle football since high school but returned to the field for this role.

title: Here are the Mass. residents who made the new Forbes list of 400 richest Americans
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: Nine Massachusetts residents featured on Forbes' list of the 400 richest Americans, ranging from ranks 27 to 382.
Abigail Johnson is Massachusetts' wealthiest individual, ranking 27th nationwide with a net worth of $35 billion.
Robert Kraft, the 78th wealthiest American, owns the New England Patriots and New England Revolution with a net worth of $13.8 billion.

title: In most anticipated series at Fenway in years, Red Sox faceplant against Yankees in opener
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Red Sox lose to Yankees 4-1 in series opener at Fenway, securing just two hits and committing three errors.
Lucas Giolito allowed two runs over 5.2 innings, but Boston failed to capitalize on offensive opportunities.
Boston's struggles include 0-for-8 with runners in scoring position and a league-leading sixth catcher's interference call.
